messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:31): anybody seen nessy around today?

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:50): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: about the broken links in IDLs in the the author view of the spec, for the static W3C copy of the author-view that I'm generating, I guess I can have the script for that rewrite the fragment IDs in the IDLs so that they point to the domintro stuff instead, but not clear to me if/how it's fixable in the dynamic/JS-switchable view of the spec

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:52): and since not all attributes in the IDLs have corresponding domintro content, I guess on I can just have the build of the static author view un-link them and instead just display them as normal text
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:53): It seems like that's mainly the case for DOM attributes that have same names as content attributes
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:53): or whatever they're currently called in the spec to distinguish them from one another
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (02:54): hsivonen: bugzilla.validator.nu seems to be responding very slowly
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:04): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: good morning

3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:11): I've just recently been practicing  HTML5, and while thinking in semantics, I thought about formatting (giving it meaning) my data. I read some web-logs which mentioned Microformats, and while it looks like an interesting approach, some others barely wrote about RDFa.

3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:11): I then checked some documents about RDFa, but I don't seem to find any examples using HTML5. I suppose it's because both need to get the recommendation status, but I wanted to check nevertheless. Given there is a DTD for RDFa with XHTML but since HTML5 doesn't use it, I wanted to know how should I start approaching RDFa in HTML5: is it okay to just start using RDFa properties, or do you rather know of/have an example?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:12): I still need to know exactly how HTML5 is going to work with DTD, or without them.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:12): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: you know of the http://dev.w3.org/html5/rdfa/ ?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:12): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: HTML5 does not rely on DTDs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:13): nobody should be using DTDs at this point, for anything
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:13): they have been obsolete for a long time
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:13): 1. Didn't know about that, thanks. :)
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:13): For some reason I never got into that link. :s
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:13): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: yeah i don't know what to do in the dynamic case
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:13): if you need a schema to use for validation, the right thing to use these days is either RelaxNG or W3C XML Schema
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:13): 2. I see, I wanted to be sure anyways.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:14): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: in the static case it might make more sense to start from the pre-anolis draft, change the domintro elements to dfn, and rerun anolis
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: hmm, yeah
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:14): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: for the dynamic case, maybe l e
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:14): oops

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: for the dynamic case, maybe one of your scripts could cause an alert to pop up, saying "The target of this link is not in the author view, do you want to switch to the full (implementor) view instead?"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:16): or something like that
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:16): I don't know how feasible that would be, though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:17): ooh that's a good idea

3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:19): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2- Fortunately, that document just mentions the changes to make the XHTML+RDFa recommendation work with HTML5, which implies it is still pretty much XHTML+RDFa.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:19): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: can you file a bug to that effect?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:20): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: yeah, will do
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:20): thanks
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:21): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e- This example is yous, isn't it? http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/alice-example.html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:21): lol, laura just implied that if the WAI isn't consulted on something, it can't be good for accessibility
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:21): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: there are some unresolved issues with full integration of RDFa into text/html
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:21): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: never seen it before
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:22): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2- Yeah, I thought so. I know they are still not Recommendations, but wanted to be sure how far they were. Thanks.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:24): 3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e: have you looked at the HTML5 Microdata feature?
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e- Oh, sorry, I got my tabs mixed, and thought it was yours. :P
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:27): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2- Well, I was reading what some search engine crawlers understood, and that's why I knew of Microformats and RDFa.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:27): Now that you mentioned HTML5 Microdata, I'm currently reading this: http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/microdata.html
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:30): The current HTML5 specification is quite large. I have to check the multipage version, otherwise the browsers take a while to load it all.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:32): Hmmm, looks interesting.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:37): Google's rich-snippets feature also supports HTML5 Microdata now
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:37): if your goal is to have search-engine support
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:41): By the way, is this the correct channel for these inquiries? I don't mean to disturb whatever you do here.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:46): especially if you have questions about the Microdata feature
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (03:46): foolip and others have used it some and can help a bit probably
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:47): Yeah, I'm currently searching using "HTML5 Microdata", and have found some articles. :D
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (03:47): The first step was knowing about it. :P
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (04:07): Wow, there are already a lot of tools for testing/trying/enjoying Microdata.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (04:07): I'm currently checking foolip's Live Microdata. :D
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (04:08): http://gitorious.org/microdatajs
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:08): yeah, like this, thatnks.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (04:08): http://james.html5.org/microdata/
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (04:08): http://philip.html5.org/demos/microdata/demo.html
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:18): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: hey, you at t45 already?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:18): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, yes I am! Why?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:19): just wondering
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:19): some trains seem to be delayed
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:19): The rain wasn't that big when I came here.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:24): aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690: if you have time in working on some HTML5-related stuff, there's a number of things that might be interesting
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:24): work on the validator.nu backend, for one
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:24): also, the RDFa WG is working on and RDFa API
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:25): Yep, I would like to join RDFa WG, I just got my W3C member account.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:25): great

aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:27): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: I am also now discussing with Fumi about holding an event for Semantic Web & Linked Data. I wonder whether I can invite you to talk about Microdata.
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:28): Actually not an event, but gatherings twice a month.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:35): if you do the event you talked about, make sure to invite Kanzaki-san

aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:38): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, yup, that's on the plan. It was very sad that I didn't meet him last year. I even bought 5 of his books, and I gave Tim one of them (should have got his signature)
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:41): anyway, I may not be the best person to present about Microdata
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:42): I'm pretty sure we could find someone who's already using it in pages
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:42): OK, but you are always welcome :) I just forwarded my plan to you.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:42): adding RDFa support to validator.nu would be another thing worth exploring
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:42): i'm not sure that's completely possible right now without some changes being made to the HTML5 parsing algorithm
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:43): but hsivonen or 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e would know better
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:43): hsivonen did an implementation a while back that didn't support CURIEs but the RDFa community did not seem to be too thrilled with that
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:43): We should be happy...don't know why.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:44): http://www.html5.jp/blog/2010/04/04/html5-api/ is interesting
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:44): But I should say, I have little knowledge about the difference of HTML+RDFa and XHTML+RDFa.
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:44): Does HTML+RDFa means RDFa 1.1 ?
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:46): By the way, CURIE like "[wiki:Test]" is a mess, we RDF community people can't live without "foaf:knows". Maybe that's what happened.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): hsivonen could give you the details about what the validator implementations issues are with respect to supporting RDFa
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:47): HTML+RDFa means supporting whatever version of RDFa in text/html MIME type
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:48): as opposed to XML MIME type
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:48): Yes, so HTML+RDFa doesn't have to meet the "copy and paste" requirement. Am I right?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:48): yeah, arguably
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:49): to put it in other terms, RDFa+HTML means supporting it RDFa documents that are parsed with HTML parsers instead of XML parsers
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (04:50): or, I guess, in any tools that don't rely on the pseudo-namespace mechanism that RDFa uses
aad758927f12b95b0cd1961f8dbee690 (04:51): OK, I need to look it up. I am not familiar with the difference between HTML DOM and XML DOM..
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (05:03): Well, I've read enough for the day. Tomorrow I'll practice a little bit more, and try to implement Microdata in a project I'm working on. Thank you all.
